## Create a presentation table based on `airquality`

### New York Air Quality Measurements

Steps in detail:

 1. we take the `datasets::airquality` data.frame
 
 2. the 'minimal' theme is applied
 
 3. the Helvetica font is applied to all columns
 
 4. all column values are right aligned
 
 5. the `Month` and `Day` columns are moved to the beginning of the column series
 
 6. we are formatting numbers in the `Wind` column to have 1 decimal place
 
 7. we replace missing (NA) values in all columns with a string replacement

```{r create_gt_object}
airquality_tbl <-
  tab_create(tbl = airquality) %>%  # 1
  theme_striped() %>%  # 2
  fmt_font(font = "Helvetica") %>%  # 3
  cols_align_right() %>%  # 4
  cols_move_to_start(columns = c("Month", "Day")) %>% # 5
  fmt_number(
    columns = "Wind",
    decimals = 1)  %>% # 6
  replace_missing(replacement = "&lt; 0.1") # 7
```

```{r show_table, echo=FALSE}
airquality_tbl
```
